more.requirement:  Technical Skills: Must be fluent in Photoshop, Ai, Indesign  Language Skills: Must be fluent in English and Vietnamese  Confidence: Able to manage and lead other creative staff  Technical Craftsmanship: Design wiz  Enthusiast: Passionate about designing and delivering superb presentations using design, color concepts, typography, hierarchy and flow  Professionalism: True professional in this field with the ability to relate well with all levels of AFG
more.description: Head of Design - Al Fresco’s Group Vietnam Ready to make your next career move and head up the national design department of a dynamic market leader in Vietnam’s hospitality sector? The Al Fresco’s Group Vietnam has grown over its 20 years in Vietnam to become a leading restaurant chain, currently with over 50 restaurants and 6 prime brands operating in Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City and Danang. If you think you can provide cool, calm and inspiring leadership to our national design team when the pressure is really on; when the deadlines are insane, and when the workload just keeps growing, then we want to hear from you. The position is based in HCMC and reports to the Group Marketing Manager also based in HCMC. Your design team of 3 staff are in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi and so some travel to Hanoi /Danang will be a requirement. And you will normally work 5.5 days per week. Salary will be negotiable and based on the talent you can bring to our Group. Summary of key responsibilities and accountabilities: 1. Managing and developing the AFG Design Department in SGN/HN and DAN., including managing and tasking the 3 design team staff in HCMC & HN 2. Developing and implement a new production system for the design department to ensure clear and easy understanding of your dept.’s work scheduling 3. Liaising with brand managers, restaurant managers and endeavoring to provide them with the best possible support from the AFG design team. 4. Contributing to and developing marketing plans and strategies of the AFG with the Group Marketing Manager and Marketing Team 5. Working with the Group Marketing Manager to support the Southern & Northern Area Managers and other senior managers in AFG. 6. Developing design briefs by gathering information and data to clarify design issues. 7. Applying creativity to produce new ideas using a wide range of media, including photography, movies and computer aided design 8. Setting the standard for the design team in producing accurate and high quality work within tight deadlines. 9. Contributing ideas and design artwork to the overall brief Liaising with printers and other suppliers 10. Mentoring your colleagues and maintaining a sense of humor when everyone around you is losing theirs.
